comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: Possibly Agustín Garza Galindo who is described as part of a reform commission concerning the in Mexican penal code in 1913. www.juridicas.unam.mx/publica/rev/hisder/cont/13/cnt/cnt2...

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: The first letters look like Agn, so that might be the best guess.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The same name crops up as the first General Secretary of the Mexican Section of the Theosophical Society. theosophy.ph/encyclo/index.php?title=Mexico,_Theosophy_in and in a 1922 issue of the Rotarian as past president of the Rotary Club of Mexico City. books.google.com/books?id=K0QEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA83&lp...;

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: trialsanderrors, TVL 1970, and swanq: Thanks for helping us with this gentleman's name.  We'll include some of your information next time we update our description.
